node.title: Trouble Updating Moose
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
Trying to update Moose by deleting the environment and reinstalling. But this results in 'Solving environment: ' running indefinitely (+6 hours). (Mac M1) Terminal below...
`(base) Ryan@Ryans-Air-4274 ~ % conda env remove -n moose'
'(base) Ryan@Ryans-Air-4274 ~ % conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.07.15'
'Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done'
'Solving environment: failed with repodata from current_repodata.json, will retry with next repodata source.'
'Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done'
'Solving environment: \ '
start with conda update conda to get the latest version of the conda solver. it s significantly faster

Thank you, did that now it can't find plugin:
(base) Ryan@Ryans-Air-4274 ~ % conda env remove -n moose                 
Could not load conda plugin `conda-libmamba-solver`:

Much longer error message below (not shown)

looks like conda is broken
I d remove it and reinstall it. we have the install instructions for conda here at the beginning
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/conda.html

node.title: How to apply triaxial loading with predefined loads
node.bodyText: I searched for a long time and didn't find a tutorial explaining this. Can someone please show me how to do that?

Hi,
I would suggest to apply pressure boundary around the model (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/bcs/Pressure.html).
Rahim

node.title: Different value of parameter defined as material property and auxvariable
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I wrote a simple material property, I need to have it either as material property or auxvariable in the model. To extract the value from material object to aux system (and save the parameter  as another variable) i have used " MaterialRealAux", on the other hand i outputed the paterial property by seetting up "outputs = exodus" in the block. The code works properly, as expected.
So, the output of the parameter as material property sounds good, however the output of aux system does not match with it.
The results are completely different, figure below:

the figure shows the profile at first time step, red line outputed as material property and blue line outputed as auxvariable. here is the last time step:

The output of aux system is wrong at first step and does not chnage over time as should be.
why does it happen, i.e. auxvaribale shows wierd profile (like random values) while it just reads the data from material property.

Hello
Can you please paste the auxkernels block and the materials block?
To see what the syntax is
These just look like two different properties.
Note that setting the outputs to a Material outputs by default all the properties this material defines
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud
Here is the auxvariables, auxkernels and material blocks respectively:
[./stress_excess]
family = MONOMIAL
order = SECOND
block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom fault_top '
[../]
[./stress_excess_ker]
type = MaterialRealAux
property = Coulomb_Stress
variable = 'stress_excess'
execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END'
block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom fault_top '
[../]
[failure]
type = TigerFailure    #returns Coulomb stress
block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom fault_top '
mu_s = 0.6
outputs = exodus
[]

can you try order = CONSTANT for the variable?
This is what the material property output is using
I m not sure exodus output represents second order monomials right. I ll try to find a list of the ones we can represent in exodus

Thanks @GiudGiud
I changed the order=CONSTANT for the variable, but i got bad termination at the end of first time step:
Solve Converged!

Rahim

Looks like a bug.
Is this a recent version of moose?
Can you follow the debugging instructions and get us a backtrace?

node.title: Vector/Tensor operations in MOOSE
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I'm trying to run a model for a NeoHookean fiber reinforced material where the fibers are represented by vectors and the Structural Tensor is obtained by the dyadic product between the fiber vectors.
To do so, I tried to implement some methods to handle the tensor/vector operations mainely multiplication, dyadic product and dot product between the vector.
When I run my code I get "Segmentation Fault error". I added the .C file in .txt format (I hope that's okay).
AnticlinalCw.txt
The debugging message is below. I'm also trying to multiply the vector by a tensor trace, but each time i get an error that this type of vectors cannot be multiplied by a double.
I would like to know if there is an alternative way in MOOSE to do it, or if my code can be saved.
Thank you for your help!
 `Thread 1 "lollipop-dbg" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff38d4acb in AnticlinalCw::multiply_vector_tensor (this=0x555555c90aa0, a=..., tensor=...)
    at /home/antilope/projects/lollipop/src/kernels/AnticlinalCw.C:61
61            result[i] += tensor(i, j) * a[j];
(gdb) where
#0  0x00007ffff38d4acb in AnticlinalCw::multiply_vector_tensor (this=0x555555c90aa0, a=..., tensor=...)
    at /home/antilope/projects/lollipop/src/kernels/AnticlinalCw.C:61
#1  0x00007ffff38da6ac in AnticlinalCw::computeResidual (this=0x555555c90aa0,
    effective_trial_stress=@0x7fffffff50d8: -0, scalar=@0x7fffffff5128: 0)
    at /home/antilope/projects/lollipop/src/kernels/AnticlinalCw.C:322
#2  0x00007ffff38d8987 in AnticlinalCw::computeQpPK1Stress (this=0x555555c90aa0)
    at /home/antilope/projects/lollipop/src/kernels/AnticlinalCw.C:242
#3  0x00007ffff2ed5a99 in ComputeLagrangianStressPK1::computeQpStressUpdate (this=0x555555c90aa0)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/modules/solid_mechanics/src/materials/lagrangian/ComputeLagrangianStressPK1.C:33
#4  0x00007ffff2ed49b3 in ComputeLagrangianStressBase::computeQpProperties (this=0x555555c90aa0)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/modules/solid_mechanics/src/materials/lagrangian/ComputeLagrangianStressBase.C:44
#5  0x00007ffff68ebc7a in Material::computeProperties (this=0x555555c90aa0)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/framework/src/materials/Material.C:139
#6  0x00007ffff6641891 in MaterialData::reinit<std::vector<std::shared_ptr<MaterialBase>, std::allocator<std::shared_ptr<MaterialBase> > > > (this=0x555555b27300, mats=...)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/MaterialData.h:313
#7  0x00007ffff65d89f6 in FEProblemBase::reinitMaterials (this=0x555555b23310, blk_id=0, tid=0, swap_stateful=true)

#8  0x00007ffff5c49975 in ComputeUserObjectsThread::onElement (this=0x7fffffffaa40, elem=0x555555af1370)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/framework/src/loops/ComputeUserObjectsThread.C:126
#9  0x00007ffff4a0228d in ThreadedElementLoopBase<libMesh::StoredRange<libMesh::MeshBase::const_element_iterator, libMesh::Elem const*> >::operator() (this=0x7fffffffaa40, range=..., bypass_threading=false)
    at /home/antilope/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/ThreadedElementLoopBase.h:248
#10 0x00007ffff6644e1b in libMesh::Threads::parallel_reduce<libMesh::StoredRange<libMesh::MeshBase::const_element_iterator, libMesh::Elem const*>, ComputeUserObjectsThread> (range=..., body=...)
    at /home/antilope/miniforge/envs/moose/libmesh/include/libmesh/threads_pthread.h:370

Hello
since it s a seg fault you are likely accessing out of bounds, either using a debugger or a print statement, make sure
result, tensor and a are of the correct sizes

what is a ? how is it retrieved?
you can look where multiply_vector_tensor( is being called since a is an argument of that function

a is an argument of the multiply_vector_tensor( ; I tried to verify whether the size of a was correct in the function.
_a is std::vector in the code and s is a rank two tensor.
in this code i tried to implement _a = _a0/(A.trace()) but it didn't work so i'm just running it as _a = _a0
here's how _a0 is retrieved : _a0 (getParam<std::vector>("fiber_vector"))

what is "fiber_vector" in the input? Please paste the whole object
what are _a and _a0  in the header ? (.h file)

Here's the .C file
AnticlinalCw.txt
Here's the .h file
AnticlinalCw.txt
and Here is the .i file
AnticlinalCw.txt

_a is defined both in the source file
  std::vector<Real> _a = _a0 ; // 1/A.trace() * _a0 didn't work 

and in the header as a std::vector<double> _a attribute.
please make sure this does not happen

Thank you for the clarification. I corrected the code and still have the Segmentation Fault problem :
h. file
AnticlinalCw.txt
C. file
AnticlinalCw.txt

it is not fixed I still see
  std::vector<double> _a = _a0 ; // 1/A.trace() * _a0 didn't work 

in the code (the .C file, in computeQpPK1Stress())
_a, the attribute, the one that causes the seg fault, is never set
Problem Solved ! Thank you very much !

node.title: System not converging / generator power increasing far too much.
node.bodyText:
Hi there,
I am simulating a helium primary loop, heated by a reactor core, which is then linked to a secondary loop almost entirely copied from the closed brayton example in MOOSE. Things seem to work OK so far, however, the generator power is increasing extortionately and I cannot understand for the love of god why! If anyone would like to help that would be greatly appreciated.
Below is the example I used to build the secondary loop.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/modules/thermal_hydraulics/examples/brayton_cycle/brayton_cycle.html
If you are interested in checking out the system, I have dropped it in this github repo below:
https://github.com/oh304/moose_sandbox
All the best,
Oscar
@licharlot

Hi Oscar,
I think we exchanged a few emails. Hope the VTB example will help.

node.title: A kernel for calculating the residual and Jacobian contributions from a function
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE experts,
Is there any kernel to calculate the residual and Jacobian contributions from a given function (f) in the framework?
I am looking for something similar to SplitCHParsed where it calculates the contributions from df/dc. I need something that does not take the derivative of the function.
Thanks,

Hello
Do you mean a CoupledForce like kernel which takes a Function as an input?
Or do you mean an example of any kernel using a Function in the code?
Guillaume

Hello,
Sorry for the late reply. I am mostly looking for a CoupledForce like kernel which takes a Function as an input and computes the resiudal and jacobian contributions for a given function.
Thanks,
Ali

forward the function through an auxvariable  with a FunctionAux
then use this kernel
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/kernels/CoupledForce.html

node.title: MOOSE on Linux will not "release" cores after simulation is done
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
I am currently running MOOSE on a Linux desktop, and I use VS code to edit my kernel and input files, as well as enter commands into the terminal. However, since I updated MOOSE and Linux, after the first simulation I ran, MOOSE never "releases" the cores. This means the cores assigned to that simulation remain at 100% usage even after the simulation is ended. If I start another simulation in MOOSE, it doesn't use the cores that were already allocated to MOOSE in the previous simulation; it uses other available cores. So if I run simulations back to back without restarting the terminal or my entire computer occasionally, my CPU usage gets pinned to 100% very quickly. The screenshot below is after I ran one simulation on 6 cores, ended the simulation, and then started another 6-core simulation. After I ended the 2nd simulation, 12 cores still remained allocated under moose/VS code. This also occurs if I use the terminal outside of VS Code.
I know Linux or MOOSE could cause this issue, but I figured this was the best place to start. I don't know how to give more information about the problem so please let me know what more information would be helpful. It's annoying to have to restart MOOSE every time.
Thank you for the Help!

Then after I close the terminal all the cores are released:

Hello
How did you end the simulation ?
With ctrl C?
Guillaume
Yes, I am using ctrl C to end the program. Is there a better way to do that?

ctrl-c should work though... Something else is happening.
How are you launching the executable?

I launch my input files like this:
mpiexec -n 6 ./wombat-opt -i input/07-12/sinkoppositeMOD.i
Any issues with this?
Not on my machine. Not with moose_test-opt anyway. Can you confirm this happens with the MOOSE test app?

I got to the test folder and tried running my input file, but it doesn't work; says it's missing a lot of kernels. What file should I run to do this test?
(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/moose/test$ mpiexec -n 6 ./moose_test-opt -i

cd ~/projects/moose/test/tests/kernels/simple_diffusion
mpiexec -n 6 ../../../moose_test-opt -i simple_diffusion.i
(or any input files you find in ~/projects/moose/test/tests/* will suffice)
Edit:
The above test is super quick. So you might not even have time to ctl-c it. In this case, add some refinement to slow it down:
mpiexec -n 6 ../../../moose_test-opt -i simple_diffusion.i -r 5

Odd, that worked perfectly everytime, it released the cores when I used ctrl+c. This seems to only happen to my applications. I tried doing it in VScode's terminal as well to see if that was the factor and it was not. It must be my custom app which I have only added a kernel to the phase field model. Is there a way I can provide more information? I don't even know at this point.
Is your application available publicly? I myself know next to nothing about C++... but perhaps one of our other developers...

When you run with MPI, the MPI process manager is what manages the rest of the processes running. When you send ctrl+c, it sends a kill command to rank 0, but not the others. MPI on rank 0 will receive the kill signal, and will send a kill signal to the remaining processes. Which means what's happening here is that rank 0 isn't telling the other ranks to die.
What MPI implementation are you using? Is it the one from our basic install instructions using conda?
what does which mpirun return? same for mpicxx

Is this what your looking for?
(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/wombat$ which mpirun
/home/jeggeme/miniforge/envs/moose/bin/mpirun
(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/wombat$ which mpicxx
/home/jeggeme/miniforge/envs/moose/bin/mpicxx
(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/wombat$

(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/wombat$ mpicxx
Error: Command line argument is needed!

(moose) jeggeme@jeggeme-OptiPlex-Tower-7010:~/projects/wombat$

yes.
now mpirun --version, same for mpicxx

thank you so much! Should I just use that until a future MOOSE update hopefully fixes this?

I have found another weird thing about Moose/Conda holding onto cores. It will only happen if an instance of paraview is open. This is a Conda issue more than a moose issue. I've never heard of this kind of behavior being so common on a machine before...
The OpenMPI variant packages are now available if you wish to try those:
conda deactivate
conda activate base
conda env remove -n moose
conda create -n moose moose-dev openmpi

My guess is that your version of Fortran is too old to build some of the PETSc contribs. It looks like these versions should match (as they do for me):

warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

In our containers, we have to perform the following to install and make available GCC and gfortran 12.x for example:
    dnf install -y gcc-toolset-12 gcc-toolset-12-gcc gcc-toolset-12-gcc-gfortran \
        gcc-toolset-12-gcc-c++ gcc-toolset-12-gdb

    source /opt/rh/gcc-toolset-12/enable
As we can see, there is a separate package for gfortran. Perhaps all you need to do is install that one package:
dnf install gcc-toolset-9-gcc-gfortran

I tried to skip the installation of STRUMPACK, but still got an error.

node.title: The failed incremental solving in axisymmetric RZ coordinate
node.bodyText:
I have a problem which could be solved with total stain (linear elastic) in axisymmetric RZ coordinate, while the solving with incremental strain is failed. Because the plastic deformation will be considered in the following work, so the incremental scheme can not be ignored! Is there any issue with my input card or problem? The followings are my input card and geometry.
[Mesh]
  file = metal3.e
  dim = 2
[]

[GlobalParams]
  order = FIRST
  family = LAGRANGE
  displacements = 'disp_r disp_z'
[]

[Variables]
  [disp_r]
  []
  [disp_z]
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [stress_r]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [stress_z]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
[]

[Problem]
  type = FEProblem
  coord_type = RZ
[]

[Kernels]
  [disp_x]
    type = StressDivergenceRZTensors
    variable = disp_r
    component = 0
  []
  [disp_y]
    type = StressDivergenceRZTensors
    variable = disp_z
    component = 1
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [stress_r]
    type = RankTwoAux
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    variable = stress_r
    index_i = 0
    index_j = 0
    execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END'
  []
  [stress_z]
    type = RankTwoAux
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    variable = stress_z
    index_i = 1
    index_j = 1
    execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END'
  []
[]

[Functions]
  [loading]
    type = ParsedFunction
    value = 1e6*t
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [in]
    type = Pressure
    variable = disp_r
    boundary = 'in2 in1 in3'
    function = loading
    # function = 1e7
  []
  [in2]
    type = Pressure
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = 'in2 in1 in3'
    function = loading
    # function = 1e7
  []
  [bottom_z]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    value = 0
    boundary = bottom
  []
  [left_r]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_r
    value = 0
    boundary = left
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [elasticity_tensor]
    type = ComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    poissons_ratio = 0.33
    youngs_modulus = 69e9
  []
  [strain]
    type = ComputeAxisymmetricRZIncrementalStrain
  []
  [stress]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrainElasticStress
  []
  # [strain]
  #   type = ComputeAxisymmetricRZSmallStrain
  # []
  # [stress]
  #   type = ComputeLinearElasticStress
  # []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  # type = Steady

  solve_type = NEWTON

  automatic_scaling = true

  petsc_options = '-snes_ksp_ew'
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package -ksp_gmres_restart'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu superlu_dist 101'

  # controls for linear iterations
  l_max_its = 100
  l_tol = 1e-12

  # controls for nonlinear iterations
  nl_max_its = 200
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-6
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-8

  # time control
  start_time = 0.0
  dt = 0.05
  end_time = 10.0
[]

[Outputs]
  [out]
    type = Exodus
  []
[]

Hello
Please try using the Physics syntax in a separate input to see if you missed anything in the input.
Then if it still does not work let's look at the simulation log
Guillaume

The solution log is as follows.

It does not look like it's solving much with a constant residual.
Using the Physics syntax is a good first step to make sure the input is well formed.

node.title: Parsed Optimization Objects not found?
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
Moose not able to find some objects in the optimization library even though the make file has "ALL_MODULES" checked. Of the optimization module objects those labeled 'Parsed...' usually have issues. Ex....
*** ERROR ***
A 'ParsedVectorVectorRealReductionReporter' is not a registered object.

If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically loaded library, make sure that
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in the
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.
